channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cracks all along the Reddings Road, 7th April
item.description:
The cracks along the Reddings Road are appalling and make the road un-cyclable. Every few meters, there are cracks int he carriageway that are getting worse. Whilst individually they are not significant potholes, the fact that there are so many of them, and they stretch across the whole road, makes it incredibly difficult to cycle down this road. Please fill these cracks as a matter of urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Reddings Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken and uneven drain causing a lot of noise from passing vehicles, 6th April
item.description:
The drain is at the end of my driveway at 89A Station Road, Bishops Cleeve. I believe other neighbours have reported this. The noise is keeping us awake at night and is very loud and getting worse from uneven drain cover

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 89A, Station Road, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Yet more rubbish fly tipped here., 6th April
item.description:
At some point between 4:00pm on Saturday and 9:00am Sunday morning yet more rubbish has been dumped on the corner of Pates Avenue & Alstone Lane. This time it appears to be several black plastic bags, a rolled up mattress and a large TV box .
